Indicator Name: Number of emergency shelters in community
Definition: Count of facilities providing emergency overnight accommodation for GBV survivors
Definition_Plain: How many emergency shelters can survivors go to in this community?
Notes/Edge Cases: Include: women's shelters, transition houses, emergency beds. Exclude: homeless shelters without GBV mandate
Domain_Question: Can survivors access emergency and transitional housing?

Indicator Name: Number of second-stage housing units in community
Definition: Count of transitional housing units specifically for GBV survivors post-shelter
Definition_Plain: How many transitional housing units are available for survivors after they leave the shelter?
Notes/Edge Cases: Units must be designated for GBV survivors; include both organization-operated and housing authority partnerships
Domain_Question: Can survivors access emergency and transitional housing?

Definition: Average number of days from crisis contact to shelter placement
Definition_Plain: How long do survivors typically wait to get into a shelter?
Operationalization: Mean wait time; 0 if immediate access typical
Notes/Edge Cases: Based on shelter intake data; flag if shelter at capacity >50% of time
Domain_Question: Can survivors access emergency and transitional housing?

Definition: Whether shelter accommodates companion animals and number of animal spaces
Definition_Plain: Can survivors bring their pets to the shelter?
Notes/Edge Cases: Critical for rural/northern contexts where animals are common and barrier to leaving
Domain_Question: Can survivors access emergency and transitional housing?
Tier_Rationale: MEDIUM priority but critical northern context

Indicator Name: Distance to nearest shelter from community centre
Definition: Kilometres from community's main intersection/centre to nearest GBV shelter
Definition_Plain: How far do survivors have to travel to reach the nearest shelter?
Notes/Edge Cases: Use Google Maps driving distance; note if road seasonal or fly-in only
Domain_Question: Can survivors access emergency and transitional housing?

Definition: Proportion of rental housing stock that permits pets
Definition_Plain: What percentage of rental housing allows pets?
Notes/Edge Cases: Proxy indicator for housing options when leaving abuser with animals
Domain_Question: Can survivors access emergency and transitional housing?

Definition: Whether any scheduled public transit service operates in community
Definition_Plain: Is there any public transit in this community?
Notes/Edge Cases: Include: municipal bus, inter-community bus. Exclude: school bus, charter only
Domain_Name: Getting Where You Need to Go
Domain_Question: Can survivors travel to services safely?

Definition: Availability of crisis transportation (not requiring personal vehicle)
Definition_Plain: Can survivors get emergency transportation without needing their own car?
Notes/Edge Cases: Include: victim services transport, shelter pickup, crisis taxi vouchers
Domain_Name: Getting Where You Need to Go
Domain_Question: Can survivors travel to services safely?

Indicator Name: Distance to nearest hospital with SANE
Definition: Kilometres to nearest Sexual Assault Nurse Examiner program
Definition_Plain: How far is the nearest hospital where survivors can get a forensic exam after sexual assault?
Notes/Edge Cases: Critical for forensic evidence collection window (72-120 hours)
Domain_Name: Getting Where You Need to Go
Domain_Question: Can survivors travel to services safely?

Indicator Name: Availability of travel funds for GBV services
Definition: Whether dedicated travel subsidy exists for GBV service access
Definition_Plain: Is there money available to help survivors pay for travel to get services?
Notes/Edge Cases: Include: shelter travel funds, victim services travel, First Nation travel support
Domain_Name: Getting Where You Need to Go
Domain_Question: Can survivors travel to services safely?

Indicator Name: Number of transportation options for crisis situations
Definition: Count of distinct crisis transportation mechanisms available
Definition_Plain: How many different ways can survivors get emergency transportation?
Operationalization: Sum of: taxi voucher program, victim services transport, shelter pickup, volunteer driver network, etc.
Notes/Edge Cases: More options = greater accessibility; weight by 24/7 availability
Domain_Name: Getting Where You Need to Go
Domain_Question: Can survivors travel to services safely?

Definition: Type of Sexual Assault Nurse Examiner access available
Definition_Plain: What kind of access do survivors have to Sexual Assault Nurse Examiners?
Notes/Edge Cases: Currently: Whitehorse General Hospital only in Yukon
Domain_Question: Do healthcare providers recognize and respond to GBV?

Indicator Name: Number of healthcare workers with IPV training
Definition: Count of healthcare providers with documented IPV/DV training
Definition_Plain: How many healthcare workers have training on intimate partner violence?
Operationalization: Count from health authority training records
Notes/Edge Cases: Include: physicians, nurses, NPs, social workers in healthcare settings
Domain_Question: Do healthcare providers recognize and respond to GBV?

Definition: Whether community has resident or regular visiting primary care
Definition_Plain: Does the community have regular access to a doctor or nurse practitioner?
Notes/Edge Cases: Visiting = scheduled clinic days; resident = permanent practice location
Domain_Question: Do healthcare providers recognize and respond to GBV?

Indicator Name: Availability of trauma-informed mental health services
Definition: Whether mental health services with trauma specialization exist
Definition_Plain: Are there mental health services available that specialize in trauma?
Notes/Edge Cases: Include: counselling, psychology, psychiatric services with trauma training
Domain_Question: Do healthcare providers recognize and respond to GBV?

Definition: Whether Yukon Victim Services has presence/outreach in community
Definition_Plain: How can survivors access Victim Services in this community?
Notes/Edge Cases: Yukon Victim Services is territorial program; check outreach schedule
Domain_Question: Can survivors access legal protection and support?

Definition: Number of legal aid hours available for family/protection matters
Definition_Plain: How many hours of legal aid are available for family and protection matters?
Operationalization: From Yukon Legal Services Society allocation
Notes/Edge Cases: Note: legal aid eligibility is means-tested; capture total allocation
Domain_Question: Can survivors access legal protection and support?

Definition: Whether Domestic Violence Treatment Option Court serves community
Definition_Plain: Is there a specialized domestic violence court that serves this community?
Notes/Edge Cases: Whitehorse has DVTO court; check circuit court coverage for other communities
Domain_Question: Can survivors access legal protection and support?

Definition: Availability of restorative/Indigenous justice options for GBV
Definition_Plain: Are there restorative or Indigenous justice options available for GBV cases?
Notes/Edge Cases: Critical for Indigenous communities; include Community Justice programs
Domain_Question: Can survivors access legal protection and support?
Tier_Rationale: MEDIUM priority + critical for Indigenous communities

Indicator Name: Number of GBV-specific services in community
Definition: Count of organizations with explicit GBV service mandate
Definition_Plain: How many organizations in this community specifically help GBV survivors?
Notes/Edge Cases: Include: shelters, counselling, advocacy, outreach. Exclude: general social services
Domain_Question: Are crisis and counselling services available?

Definition: Whether GBV services can be accessed remotely
Definition_Plain: Can survivors access GBV services by phone or video?
Notes/Edge Cases: Critical for isolated communities; include phone, video, chat
Domain_Question: Are crisis and counselling services available?

Definition: Average days from referral to first counselling appointment
Definition_Plain: How long do survivors wait to see a counsellor?
Operationalization: Mean wait time from service provider data
Notes/Edge Cases: Capture both GBV-specific and general mental health counselling
Domain_Question: Are crisis and counselling services available?

Definition: Whether 24/7 crisis support is accessible from community
Definition_Plain: Can survivors call a crisis line any time day or night?
Notes/Edge Cases: Include: VictimLink BC, territorial crisis lines. Note if long-distance charges apply
Domain_Question: Are crisis and counselling services available?

Indicator Name: Availability of emergency financial aid for GBV survivors
Definition: Whether emergency funds specifically for GBV situations exist
Definition_Plain: Is there emergency money available specifically for GBV survivors?
Notes/Edge Cases: Include: shelter emergency funds, victim services financial assistance, First Nation emergency funds
Domain_Question: Can survivors access money and resources to leave?

Definition: Whether financial support for relocation away from abuser exists
Definition_Plain: Is there money to help survivors move away from their abuser?
Notes/Edge Cases: Include: moving costs, damage deposits, first/last month rent assistance
Domain_Question: Can survivors access money and resources to leave?

Indicator Name: Policies addressing confidentiality in RRN context
Definition: Whether GBV service providers have explicit policies for small-community confidentiality challenges
Definition_Plain: Do service providers have policies for keeping things confidential in small communities where everyone knows each other?
Notes/Edge Cases: Audit shelter, VS, health policies; look for dual-relationship, information-sharing protocols
Domain_Question: Do organizations have policies that protect survivors?
Tier_Rationale: MEDIUM priority but core to RRN measurement justice

Definition: Protocols for when service provider has pre-existing relationship with victim or perpetrator
Definition_Plain: Do service providers have policies for when they already know the survivor or abuser personally?
Notes/Edge Cases: Critical for RRN where provider likely knows both parties; audit all GBV service orgs
Domain_Question: Do organizations have policies that protect survivors?

Definition: Whether major employers, schools, health facilities have GBV workplace policies
Definition_Plain: Do major employers and schools have policies about GBV?
Operationalization: % of major employers (10+ staff) with documented policy
Notes/Edge Cases: Survey top 20 employers per community; include YG, FN governments, mines, schools
Domain_Question: Do organizations have policies that protect survivors?
Tier_Rationale: MEDIUM priority + LOW reliability (requires employer survey)

Definition: Existence and activity level of formal coordination mechanisms
Definition_Plain: How well do different agencies work together on GBV?
Notes/Edge Cases: Check for: interagency committees, shared protocols, joint training, case conferencing
Domain_Question: Do organizations have policies that protect survivors?

Definition: Whether documented referral protocols exist between key services
Definition_Plain: Are there clear documented pathways for referring survivors between services?
Operationalization: Number of documented referral pathways (max ~10 key connections)
Notes/Edge Cases: Key pathways: shelter-VS, health-shelter, RCMP-VS, legal aid-shelter, etc.
Domain_Question: Do organizations have policies that protect survivors?

Definition: Whether GBV service providers have business continuity plans
Definition_Plain: Do GBV organizations have plans to keep operating during emergencies?
Notes/Edge Cases: Post-COVID relevance; include pandemic, wildfire, flood scenarios
Domain_Question: Do organizations have policies that protect survivors?

Indicator Name: Workplace GBV policies in extractive industry
Definition: Whether active mine sites have documented GBV/harassment policies
Definition_Plain: Do mining companies have policies about GBV and harassment?
Operationalization: % of active mine sites with policy
Notes/Edge Cases: Direct YESAB relevance; audit policies of Minto, Eagle Gold, Victoria Gold, Casino
Domain_Question: Do organizations have policies that protect survivors?

Definition: Existence of formal agreements enabling coordinated data collection
Definition_Plain: Do agencies have agreements to share data with each other?
Operationalization: Number of active data-sharing MOUs among GBV-relevant agencies
Notes/Edge Cases: Foundational for future measurement; note where agreements are needed but absent
Domain_Question: Do organizations have policies that protect survivors?

Definition: Annual turnover rate in frontline GBV positions
Definition_Plain: How often do staff leave GBV organizations?
Notes/Edge Cases: High turnover = service instability; survey shelters, VS, counselling orgs
Domain_Question: Do organizations have policies that protect survivors?

Definition: Vacancy rates and burnout indicators in GBV sector
Definition_Plain: Are GBV organizations fully staffed and are workers burning out?
Operationalization: Vacancy rate % + burnout survey score (if available)
Notes/Edge Cases: Predictive of service availability; may require anonymous workforce survey
Domain_Question: Do organizations have policies that protect survivors?

Definition: Whether local/accessible GBV training opportunities exist for workforce
Definition_Plain: Can workers access specialized GBV training locally?
Notes/Edge Cases: Include: in-territory training, funded travel to training, online options
Domain_Question: Do organizations have policies that protect survivors?

Definition: Whether structured debriefing/supervision exists for GBV workers
Definition_Plain: Do GBV workers have access to professional debriefing and supervision?
Notes/Edge Cases: Vicarious trauma mitigation; audit policies of GBV service orgs
Domain_Question: Do organizations have policies that protect survivors?

Indicator Name: Indigenous cultural safety training in healthcare
Definition: Whether healthcare workers have completed Indigenous cultural safety training
Definition_Plain: Have healthcare workers completed Indigenous cultural safety training?
Operationalization: % of health staff with training (estimate from HSS)
Notes/Edge Cases: San'yas or equivalent; critical for Indigenous survivor trust
Domain_Question: Do healthcare providers recognize and respond to GBV?

Definition: Degree to which available MH services meet trauma-informed standards
Definition_Plain: How well do mental health services actually meet trauma-informed standards?
Notes/Edge Cases: Goes beyond binary availability; assess actual training/certification
Domain_Question: Do healthcare providers recognize and respond to GBV?

Definition: Whether GBV service information distributed via formats accessible without internet
Definition_Plain: Can survivors learn about services without needing internet access?
Notes/Edge Cases: Internet access unreliable in RRN; audit actual distribution methods
Domain_Question: Are crisis and counselling services available?
Tier_Rationale: MEDIUM priority but core to RRN accessibility

Definition: Whether GBV services available in local First Nation languages
Definition_Plain: Can survivors access services in their First Nation language?
Notes/Edge Cases: 8 FN language families in Yukon; note which languages served
Domain_Question: Are crisis and counselling services available?
Tier_Rationale: MEDIUM priority but core to Indigenous access

Definition: Degree to which services are co-located or require multiple separate contacts
Definition_Plain: How many different places do survivors have to go to get help?
Notes/Edge Cases: Navigation burden on survivors; Whitehorse has more integration than rural
Domain_Question: Are crisis and counselling services available?

Definition: Rate at which EPOs are granted and enforced
Definition_Plain: Do Emergency Protection Orders actually get granted and enforced?
Operationalization: % EPO applications granted; % breaches resulting in enforcement
Notes/Edge Cases: Requires court data; measures whether legal protection actually functions
Domain_Question: Can survivors access legal protection and support?
Tier_Rationale: MEDIUM priority + LOW reliability (RCMP data via ATIP)

Indicator Name: Community readiness for new GBV programs
Definition: Assessment of implementation feasibility for new interventions
Definition_Plain: Is the community ready to support new GBV programs?
Operationalization: Community Readiness Model score (1-9) via key informant interviews
Notes/Edge Cases: Useful for recommendations; requires structured key informant protocol
Domain_Question: How does the broader context affect survivor safety?

Definition: Impact of market trends (AirBnB, mining camps, speculation) on rental availability
Definition_Plain: How much pressure is there on the housing market from things like AirBnB and mining?
Operationalization: Rental vacancy rate + rent-to-income ratio + short-term rental count
Notes/Edge Cases: Contextualizes housing barriers; CMHC + municipal data
Domain_Question: Can survivors access emergency and transitional housing?

Definition: Additional costs faced by survivors in RRN contexts
Definition_Plain: How much extra does it cost survivors to live in a rural/remote area?
Operationalization: Estimated annual additional cost (fuel, animal care, travel)
Notes/Edge Cases: Economic coercion context; calculate from cost-of-living data
Domain_Question: Can survivors access money and resources to leave?

Definition: Access to licensed childcare as economic independence enabler
Definition_Plain: How available is childcare for parents trying to become independent?
Notes/Edge Cases: Barrier to employment; Yukon childcare registry data
Domain_Question: Can survivors access money and resources to leave?

Definition: Composite measure of community isolation
Definition_Plain: How isolated is this community?
Operationalization: Weighted composite: distance to hub + transport options + internet + cell coverage
Notes/Edge Cases: Risk multiplier for all other indicators; calculated once, updated as infrastructure changes
Domain_Question: How does the broader context affect survivor safety?

Definition: Whether active GBV prevention/education programs operate in community
Definition_Plain: Are there programs in the community to educate people about GBV prevention?
Notes/Edge Cases: Primary prevention; inventory all education initiatives
Domain_Question: How does the broader context affect survivor safety?

Definition: Availability of programs engaging men/boys in GBV prevention
Definition_Plain: Are there programs that engage men and boys in preventing GBV?
Notes/Edge Cases: Perpetration prevention; relatively rare - note if exists
Domain_Question: How does the broader context affect survivor safety?
